info.info2: This course serves as the introductory offering in Africana Studies. It explores, in an interdisciplinary fashion, salient aspects of the Black experience, both ancient and modern, and at the local, national and international levels. This course provides an overview of many related themes, including slavery, Africanisms, gender, colonialism, civil rights, and pan-African exchange.
CRN: 13587; Credit Hours: 1; Current Enrollment: 17; Seats Available: 29; Max Enrollment: 46;
Meeting Time(s): T - 01:30 pm - 04:00 pm Loc: Founders Hall 120
Distributions: HS - Historical Studies; SBA - Social and Behavioral Analysis
